image.altText: A triangular chart showing an example of some electorates shifting from LNP to 'Other candidates' at the 2025 federal election

props.synopsis: Labor took the glory, but beneath the surface of the election result an ongoing trend holds a warning for both major parties.

title.children: 'Third party' vote looks set to beat Coalition

image.altText: A composite image of Itamar Ben-Gvir, Donald Trump and Bezalel Smotrich.

props.synopsis: The controversial leaders of Israel's far-right politics were boycotted by the US in the past. But they've been meeting with Donald Trump's officials and dining at his resort.

title.children: Trump says he has a new plan for Gaza. Who is he listening to?

image.altText: Two men in orange hi vis vest, with one holding up a dollar coin

props.synopsis: Hopefully everyone who has been elected can retain a muscle memory of the goodwill that seemed to be abroad on election night.

title.children: Labor win turns sour as the bloody realpolitik takes centre stage

image.altText: A digital drawing of Erin Patterson wearing a pink shirt

props.synopsis: The second week of the Erin Patterson murder trial has seen a cavalcade of crucial witnesses, including the daughter of the accused killer.

title.children: A girl's police interview brings 'truth' into focus during mushroom murder trial

image.altText: India intercepts objects in the sky in Jammu

props.synopsis: The attacks were underway after India fired missiles at three air bases inside Pakistan this week, according to Pakistan's state media.

title.children: Pakistan launches retaliatory strikes against India as conflict intensifies

image.altText: A close-up of Andre's hands, tinged blue under a UV light, holding a neon yellow piece of coral.

props.synopsis: Sought-after pieces of coral are sold all around the world, including at rave-like trade shows known as "frag swaps". The insatiable demand for a "piece of the reef" has put coral harvesting in the spotlight.

title.children: Banned abroad, booming at home: Inside Australia's coral industry

image.altText: Two of India's French-made Rafale fighter jets in lockstep in the sky at Aero India 2021.

props.synopsis: For decades, India has suffered the deaths of soldiers, security personnel and civilians in its state of Kashmir from cross-border terrorism. Nine years ago, it decided to try something new.

title.children: India's retaliation to terror attacks reflects a changed strategy. Is it working?

image.altText: Jacinta Price speaks while Dutton stands behind her listening.

props.synopsis: NT Labor claims Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price's defection is driven by "ego", while a long-time politics watcher labels the move a "considerable gamble".

title.children: Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price warned against more 'surprise' moves

image.altText: a photo of two females in red jackets looking and smiling at camera

props.synopsis: Labor MP Lisa Chesters has won a fifth term as member for Bendigo but has lost the seat's safe status.

title.children: 'Deep dissatisfaction' drives Bendigo's heavy swing against Labor

image.altText: A man with a t-shirt, hat and sunglasses on top of his head smiles at camera.

props.synopsis: Consumers will see the price for home batteries slashed by the federal government. With a mandate to address climate change, investment in renewables is expected to soar.

title.children: 'We've hit the lottery': Businesses cash in on Labor's home battery rebate

image.altText: A composite image of Pope Leo and US President Donald Trump

props.synopsis: The election of Pope Leo XIV brings the Catholic Church closer to the United States in a way it has never been before, but with that comes a unique challenge.

title.children: 'This is a warning to Trump': What MAGA thinks of Pope Leo's election

image.altText: A composite of Australian cash with lady gaga

props.synopsis: A new Lady Gaga album, knee-high Converse and Snooki at the club. According to social media, signs of a recession are everywhere.

title.children: Lady Gaga at Coachella? This meme says it may be a recession indicator

image.altText: a overview of Bayesian yacht

props.synopsis: Police say the Dutch national diver was underwater in Porticello when the accident happened, and the cause of death remains unknown.

title.children: Diver dies in preliminary operations to recover dead tycoon's superyacht

image.altText: A Melbourne Storm player in a shirt with an Indigenous design on it.

props.synopsis: The Victorian Aboriginal Health Service severs ties with the Melbourne Storm after the NRL club's decision to cancel a Welcome to Country before its Anzac Day game.

title.children: Welcome to Country snub costs Melbourne Storm major partner

image.altText: Kim Jong Un at event

props.synopsis: Kim Jong Un called North Korea’s involvement in the Russia-Ukraine an exercise of sovereign rights in defence of a "brother nation".

title.children: Kim Jong Un says participation in Russia-Ukraine war justified

image.altText: A man holds a small lizard in his hand.

props.synopsis: Regional areas are struggling to attract workers nationwide but staff shortages are even more acute in remote areas.

title.children: Workers take on tough but rewarding lifestyle in remote community

image.altText: Brothers max and sam at a karate class with their instructor, the bodies of the boys were found inside their coonabarabran home

props.synopsis: The bodies of the boys, aged six and seven, were found inside a home at Coonabarabran on Monday.

title.children: Woman charged with murder of her two grandsons

image.altText: Donald Trump

props.synopsis: If the newly re-elected Albanese government is serious about Australian culture and production, then Donald Trump could be inadvertently showing the way to ensuring it.

title.children: If Albanese is serious about Aussie culture, Trump could be key to protecting it

image.altText: Women wheelchair basket ballers are on the court fighting for the ball.

props.synopsis: Women's wheelchair basketball is facing an uphill battle to qualify for the 2032 Paralympics, with concerns about a lack of grassroots opportunities and funding.

title.children: Paralympic medallists looking to rebuild women's wheelchair basketball

image.altText: measles virus particle

props.synopsis: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention says 14 outbreaks have been recorded this year, with 93 per cent of confirmed cases being outbreak-associated.

title.children: Measles outbreaks reported in 11 US states, surpassing 1,000 cases

image.altText: A small circular spacecraft

props.synopsis: An out-of-control Soviet-era spacecraft will plummet back to Earth today, if the latest tracking predictions are correct. But there's still a lot experts don't know.

title.children: Where will the Soviet-era probe crash back to Earth today?

image.altText: Protesters seen holding signs and chanting slogans in Taipei.

props.synopsis: The so-called Great Recall campaign in Taiwan is deepening domestic political divides and rocking the self-ruled island's democracy.

title.children: 'Hostile China will be very pleased': Taiwan politics in crisis

image.altText: a young man with a hat hugging his white dog

props.synopsis: Anthony Rowse builds skip bins for a living. At night, he sleeps in a tent by a lake with his dog, Ghost, as one of a growing number of homeless regional Victorians.

title.children: Worker makes plea to housing inquiry before going home to his tent

image.altText: A brown border collie pup

props.synopsis: With an exceptional work ethic, intelligence and ability to thrive in various climates, the demand for Australian working dogs is rising internationally.

title.children: Adorable Aussie border collie pup set for new work life on tropical island

image.altText: Elaine house drone

props.synopsis: A year has passed since a surprise tornado struck WA's second-largest city, Bunbury, damaging 220 homes and destroying nine, but some are still without a permanent place to live.

title.children: Couple 'basically homeless' a year on from freak tornado

image.altText: Marta Kostyuk clenches her fist during a tennis match.

props.synopsis: After years of refusing to acknowledge Russian players after matches, Ukrainian Marta Kostyuk shakes the hand of Daria Kasatkina after her defection to Australia.

title.children: Ukrainian praises Kasatkina's courage in stepping away from Russia

image.altText: Rosemary Harwood

props.synopsis: Marjorie Harwood died in 2018 after refusing life-saving treatment. Her mother, Rosemary Harwood, says it was because Marjorie was fearful of returning to prison, but her application for an inquest into her daughter's death has been refused.

title.children: Mother vows to keep fighting for investigation into daughter's death

image.altText: Emergency services at Westfield Bondi Junction after multiple people were killed

props.synopsis: A lost email concerning Joel Cauchi's declining mental health, an overlooked emergency assessment and a briefly-empty CCTV security room are all being considered "missed opportunities" in the Bondi Junction stabbing inquest.

title.children: The string of 'missed opportunities' before fatal Bondi Westfield stabbing

props.synopsis: After a disaster in the Nepalese Himalayas, Armando Corvini thought he might never walk again. But he's proving age and a disability cannot stop him.

title.children: 'A love story': Meet the 85yo rock climbing instructor with no fingers or toes

image.altText: An aerial photo of a housing development beside the ocean

props.synopsis: Thousands of blocks are hitting the market in Queensland's Wide Bay as communities grapple with population growth and changing identities.

title.children: Sleepy coastal towns becoming 'next Sunshine Coast' as development booms

image.altText: A woman peers over the top of the book she is reading

props.synopsis: For millions of devoted readers, romantasy is more than spicy sex scenes and towering warriors with impressive wingspans. It's escapism in its purest form.

title.children: Romantasy might seem like pure smut but to its fans it's so much more

image.altText: Two small boats with people in uniform in the foreground and a large ship with a crane on it in the background.

props.synopsis: Designed to probe the devastating downing of an army helicopter that killed four people, the Taipan inquiry became something so much more — exposing deep flaws within the Australian Defence Force and exploring the very core of its culture.

title.children: Taipan inquiry shows defence has some hard truths to face

image.altText: A man stands in front of several black plastic trays piled on top of each other.

props.synopsis: A Coffin Bay oyster farmer and his recycling team have spent weeks shredding waste plastic from producers on the NSW coast in the hopes of boosting the industry's recycling.

title.children: Shredder helps recycle 'half a footy field' of plastic from oyster farms

image.altText: Keith stands under a gum tree holding a pair on binoculars

props.synopsis: Native vegetation returns in abundance to Victoria's Barmah National Park in an "amazing" rebound an ecologist says has never been witnessed before.

title.children: Brumby cull makes way for 'magical landscape change' in national park
